article_node.title: Ex University President at Center of Anti-Israel Firestorm Lands Top UK Job
article_node.summary: Former Columbia University president Minouche Shafik has been named chief economic adviser to UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer, a move aimed at bolstering the Labour government’s economic response amid sluggish growth and inflation. Shafik, a former Bank of England deputy governor, brings extensive policy experience but her brief, controversial tenure at Columbia ended after protests over the Israel‑Hamas war. The appointment signals Starmer’s intent to strengthen economic expertise while addressing immigration and fiscal challenges.
